description: From Ancient Greek σχέσις (skhésis, “state, condition, attitude”). See scheme.

entries.meaning: (obsolete) General state or disposition of the body or mind, or of one thing with regard to other things; habitude.
examples: For if that Mind which has Existing in it self from all Eternity, all the Simple Essences of Things , and conſequently , all their poſſible Scheſes or Habitudes, should ever change, there would arise a new Schesis in this Mind that was not before
